name: Intro to CS
description: This SIG will allow members who are new and old to the realm of computer science to refresh their memories or learn about the principles of what computer science entails.

name: Game Development
description: For Game Dev SIG this semester we'll be working to create a racing game in Unity! We hope you'll get some hands on experience and a deliverable you can talk about in interviews. We also hope to visit a game development company and tour their headquarters at some point in the semester!

name: Interview Prep
description: The Interview Preparation special interest group is the perfect place for students interested in discovering new information about careers in the tech space. Topics covered within this SIG will include: the technical interview and common questions, the behavioral interview, career fair, landing your first job, types of careers in tech, technologies to explore, mock interviews

name: Virtual Reality
description: The VR SIG is focused on engaging with and developing for Virtual Reality technologies.

name: MU Robotics - ML/AI
description: In a collaboration with the MU Robotics org, the ML/AI SIG will have members dive into the making, maintaining, and piloting of robotics.

name: App Development
when: Every other Tuesday @ 6:00 PM starting from Feb 15st, Lafferre C2205
description: This will be a project oriented SIG and we will have a beginner project and an advanced project so we accept all different kinds of people. Our SIG will focus on iOS dev but Android devs are welcome as well. We also need people to build backends for our full stack projects so if you're interested in that we would also love to have you.

name: Web Development
leadBy: Erika Zhou, Katelyn Van Dyke, & Hannah Bushman
description: The Web Development Special Interest Group is a mini-club to learn and code together and build web project(s). You may learn skills in programming languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript; tools such as GitHub, Figma, and Replit; and frameworks such as Bootstrap. Also, you may gain experience with working in a team, prototyping, and visual design. No prior experience is needed to join; come online and code with us!
